CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 11, 1961, pg. 24, reads: "Boat Show Ace - Carnegie Hero Medal winner Alphonso Woodall is the rave notice of Pittsburgh's Boat Show, which is scheduled to last through March 11, at Hunt Armory. Woodall is billed as the 'World's Greatest Human Kite,' and once flew across Lake Erie.  Hobbling on crutches, after suffering fractures of both legs, in a kite crash, Woodall, the father of five, dived into Lake Erie and saved a drowning motorboat skipper.  The feat won him the Carnegie Medal.  He is the main attraction at the Boat Show, and especially makes a hit with the children. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Carnegie Medal awardee Alphonso Woodall seated in boat inscribed "Alphonso Woodall: The World's Greatest Human Kite," at Pittsburgh Boat Show, Hunt Armory
